summary: The Supermarine Spitfire is a famous British fighter plane from World War II. Designed by R.J. Mitchell, it had a unique wing shape and was very fast. The Spitfire was used by the Royal Air Force and helped defend Britain during the Battle of Britain. It was loved by its pilots and could do many jobs, like fighting, bombing, and reconnaissance. Even after the war, Spitfires were still used until the 1950s. Today, around 70 Spitfires can still fly, and many more are in museums.
title: Supermarine Spitfire
